newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China Light, HK Elec up on warrants talk.
newsitem.headline: China Light, HK Elec up on warrants talk.

text.p: Shares of China Light & Power Co Ltd and Hongkong Electric Co Ltd rose on Monday on market talk of warrant issues on the stocks, brokers said.
"Talk of a basket of warrants to be issued on utilities stocks, comprising China Light and HongKong Electric, fueled buying," said a sales manager at a regional brokerage.
China Light rose HK$1.80 or 4.6 percent to HK$40.60 in late morning. Hongkong Electric shares gained HK$0.30 to HK$28.20.

Brokers said anticipation that the warrant issuers might need to buy the stocks to cover the warrants boosted buying. They said investors switching to laggards following the recent rally in the overall stock market also underpinned demand for the utilities stocks.
